presentation.title: Creating the Composable Enterprise
presentation.toc: Digital transformation not only requires a specific focus on digital opportunities, it also requires the ability to change and adapt easily. Managing everything as a building block makes every capability easily usable and reusable. In a digital world, building blocks become digital building blocks, and all capabilities of an enterprise should be managed as digital building blocks. While the general idea is well-known and accepted, many organizations struggle with how to put the general idea into action. We look at the value proposition and how it translates into clear requirements for an Application Programming Interface (API) platform. We also look into how to define a strategy and a program so that organizations make progress towards establishing and evolving their API platforms.

p.q: A platform is a business model that facilitates the exchange of value between two or more user groups, a consumer and a producer. In order to make these exchanges happen, platforms harness and create large, scalable networks of users and resources that can be accessed on demand. Platforms create communities and markets that allow users to interact and transact. […] Platforms don't, to use a common phrase, own the means of production—instead, they create the means of connection.
p.span: (Alex Moazed and Nicholas L. Johnson, Modern Monopolies, St. Martin's Press, 2016)
